event_text: The apprentices of the Clan are taking special strength training to learn how to weaponize stones and boulders in the mountainous landscape.

As a storm rages across the mountain outside, m_c is tucked up in the medicine cat den, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sleep anything but restful. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/keep/keeps} seeing flashes of prophecy_list_sight. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wake/wakes} with a shiver, wondering what {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dreams mean for the Clan.
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, happily sharing how m_c managed to keep a snail as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pet.
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a cute, slowly moving snail! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c cooes at the little thing as m_c carries it home.
m_c skips back into camp with a pep in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} step... and with a new noodly, harmless friend!

r_c chirps softly at m_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} over, and offers to show {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a cool, silly little snake {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found! m_c takes {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} invitation. After seeing the weird, harmless thing, m_c decides to take it home with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c gently guides a acc_singular into camp. Seems like m_c has found a new friend?
r_c and m_c, on a walk together, stumble upon an acc_singular. m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head, and decides to take it home! r_c is charmed by m_c's generosity.

m_c finds paths and twists of healthy green ivy growing down just above the leader's den. Looking left and right for any cat paying attention to them, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} quickly snap a pair of leaves off of one of the lower branches. m_c is seen wearing the ivy shortly after.

r_c offers m_c some ivy {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to find, telling {PRONOUN/m_c/object} that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} made sure it wasn't the itchy kind. m_c tilts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} head and accepts {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} offer, wearing the pretty leaves with a little smile.

m_c gets smacked on the head by a falling stick! Grumbling, but liking the perfectly sized stick too much to destroy it out of rage, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/takes/take} it and {VERB/m_c/takes/take} to carry it around.
r_c offers m_c a stick that bonked them on the head earlier today, figuring that m_c could make some kind of use of it. m_c accepts, and carries it around with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}!
m_c spots collections and clusters of gorgeous acc_singular, and decides to wear one of them!
r_c offers m_c acc_singular {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found near camp, telling m_c that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} thought that it'd look better on m_c than on {PRONOUN/r_c/self}.
m_c wonders out on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} own on a odd day, and comes back with a fruity smelling acc_singular! m_c flaunts their new acc_singular with grace.

r_c and m_c decide to go for a short walk together! r_c blinks in surprise, before pointing out a yew tree {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} managed to spot from a ways away! m_c tells r_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} a good eye, and decides to tread over and wear the acc_singular! r_c compliments {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, and m_c grins, flustered.
m_c wanders around camp mindlessly with r_c's permission. m_c spots a fruity smelling acc_singular that rolled into camp! m_c flaunts their new acc_singular with grace.
m_c brags about r_c giving them acc_singular to wear.
m_c comes into camp with a happy glint in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} eye, and a dangling worm in their jaws...!?
r_c and m_c go on a walk together! After a while, m_c and r_c run into a light pink, squirmy little worm! m_c decides to keep it as a pet, and r_c cooes at the little thing as m_c carries it home.

m_c leaps and gracefully sweeps across the plains of c_n territory. m_c quickly scans the scenery around {PRONOUN/m_c/object} inbetween leaps, and quickly finds that a acc_singular has joined {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} walk. m_c decides to keep it when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/speed/speeds} back to camp.

m_c and r_c both leap and gracefully sweep across the plains of c_n territory. m_c quickly scans the scenery around them both inbetween a shared leap, and quickly finds that a acc_singular has joined {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} walk. m_c decides to keep it when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/speed/speeds} back to camp.

r_c spots acc_singular near camp. Before r_c can rip {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} way through camp and to the acc_singular, m_c stops {PRONOUN/r_c/object} and tells {PRONOUN/r_c/object} that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/want/wants} it as a pet. r_c opens {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth to hiss at m_c, but the kit bounds over to the acc_singular. Guess it's too late to catch it...

m_c's eyes dilate as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/focus/focuses} on a rabbit near the dirt-place. m_c has been taught all {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} life that hunting was the only thing that a warrior did near rabbits... but this one was so cute. m_c wanders towards it, and quickly befriends it!
m_c eyes a pink-nosed rat that wondered into the warrior's den. Before r_c can even think about stopping {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, m_c befriends the weird little thing with a piece of grass.
The things {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw today, omen_list_sight... m_c sits on an isolated mountain ledge, considering what the omens foretell.

Through the long, cold night, m_c brings the young cats of the Clan with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} down the tunnels. {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} words paint an enchanting picture of the ancestors of c_n as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/point/points} out the red pawprints of long dead heroes and villains, telling the Clan's triumphs and failures.
